name: WARSTUFF
overview:
A niche marketplace for militaria and military antiques with rules and policies to suit militaria dealers and collectors:

  • Legal to sell items, can be sold including antique weapons, WW2 items, collectable blades and inert ordinance
  • Niche military history destination for loyal collectors with brand that resonates
  • Features specific to militaria market, plus all the features of mainstream marketplaces

WARSTUFF is a marketplace noteable as a niche destination that allows the listing and sale of militaria and military collectables that other generalist auction sites such as eBay do not allow. WARSTUFF Valued is a online valuations service to compliment the marketplace providing low cost valuations of militaria in 48 hours.

Founded in 2009, WARSTUFF allows a growing community of buyers and sellers to trade in all of these items as long as the sales do not contravene site usage policy.

WARSTUFF offers free membership for Buyers and paid monthly subscriptions for Sellers. The site offers sales by auctions, buy it now and classifieds. There is also a mobile version of the site and a mobile app.

Sellers can import listings and feedback from eBay using a custom Import feature. The site also enables bulk uploads of items via a CSV template, and import of inventory via RSS feeds from Sellers own websites.

WARSTUFF maintains 20 specialty sites aimed at collectors and dealers with interests in specific conflicts. Vietnamwarstuff.com, for example, provides information about the Vietnam War and showcases Vietnam War Relics for sale on the parent site.

WARSTUFF also operates facebook, twitter, pinterest and youtube sites as well as a blog. Posts include interesting links pertaining to war history, militaria, relics, armed services news, and more. A monthly newsletter is sent out which includes a digest of the community content posted over the month as well as news on site developments and notable items for sale.

A number of unusual items have been placed for sale on WARSTUFF in the last year, including a restored 1970s Hawker Harrier Jump Jet for static display that eBay publically rejected as it contravened their weapons policy, and a Hawker Hurricane WW2 fighter plane in flying condition that carried a price tag of Â£2m.

If military history or collecting militaria is your passion, then WARSTUFF is for you. It’s run by collectors just like you. Get in touch with us, we’re interested in partnerships, business opportunities and investment.

milestones.description: WARSTUFF goes Premium. Paid memberships for sellers added.
